intro: Hybanthus domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows as a climbing plant with tendrils that help it ascend supports. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
